intro: Tabernaemontana psychotriifolia, commonly known as the Psychotriifolia Tabernaemontana, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with showy flowers and often toxic properties. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings.
